group_1.textRight: Hey hey!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, welcome.
Ah...

group_1.textRight: What a coincidence.
...Don't tell me you're looking for something you've@lost, again?

group_1.textLeft: No, certainly not.@I was returning the book to the library...
...and I stopped here on the way back!
She came all the way here just to say "thank you."

group_1.textRight: We'll buy something, too.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks!

group_1.textRight: Ah... I see.
As for me, I've been thinking about that folklorist@from before.

group_1.textLeft: About... Tasuke Satomi?

group_1.textRight: Like, what kind of person he is, and stuff.

group_1.textLeft: He's still a young scholar, but he's already being@called an expert in his field.
I get the impression he's modest about it, but he's@done a wide range of solid research.
Certainly, for a Liberal Arts researcher, he may still@be young.
But you might even call him a great scholar.@He seems to have an overwhelming amount of knowledge.

group_1.textRight: ...I see.
Actually, the thing I'm really curious about is that@map.

group_1.textLeft: This one, right?

group_1.textRight: Your phone...?@Oh, so you took a pic of the map?

group_1.textLeft: I thought the map might be someone's personal belonging, so I returned it to the librarian.
But, since I found it kind of interesting...
...I secretly took a picture of it on my phone first.
Even though I told you you shouldn't...

group_1.textRight: About that scholar, the Satomi guy...
There were some weird rumors about whether his@book was retracted or not.
Could it be...that he put some kind of map to buried treasure inside that book...?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm...I wonder.@That was a handwritten map, wasn't it?
Would the author himself put a handwritten map@inside a copy of his book?
He doesn't seem like the kind of person who would engage with something as lowbrow as "buried treasure."

group_1.textRight: I see.  Yeah, there's probably no connection there...

group_1.textLeft: That "X" mark...
Unless a pot full of old coins turns up in the cellar@of the Tomorrow Shop...
Did you find something like that?

group_1.textRight: Ah... No, nothing like that.
(...They weren't "old" coins.@They were just "gold" coins!)
(So, not really a "buried treasure" vibe, perhaps...)
...Well, what if the map is related to some kind of@crime?

group_1.textLeft: That's not out of the question...
What if someone put a map to ill-gotten gains@inside the Tasuke Satomi book...
And accidentally sold the book to a used book@store...
And now a crime syndicate is rushing to buy up@all of the Tasuke Satomi books?
That sounds like a plot out of one of Furuyashiki's books, doesn't it?
...It does, doesn't it?  Well, just your typical wild delusion, then!

group_1.textRight: Wild delusion?!

group_1.textLeft: I think that map was most likely just someone's@idea of fun.
Yes, that book that I borrowed was written a long@time ago.
A criminal organization buying up all the copies of@an old book...
Wouldn't a newer book be more likely to be the@subject of attention due to a lack of stock?

group_1.textRight: ...Yeah, you're right.
The plot needs to be reworked in order to make that part cleaner.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe the criminal organization mixes up the title@of the book with another one and ends up buying up those instead?

group_1.textRight: ...I really wasn't thinking about the plot of some@novel, here.
Well, I more or less got your point.@Thanks!

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad we were able to be of some help.
Oh, I'll send you that photo of the map, if you'd like!

group_1.textRight: Oh, yes please!
